title: Fall of the Ancient Civilization
summary: The day the world’s impossible cities failed; Year 0 is counted from this collapse.

title: ⟂ Age of Ash & Silence
summary: Survival, famine, and fear of ruins; the world is quiet and broken, and most communities last only a season.

title: ᛒ Age of Reclamation
summary: Writing, law, and agriculture return; proto-kingdoms form and the old roads are found again, half-buried.

title: ᛉ Age of Crowns
summary: Dynasties harden into kingdoms; borders are named, faiths codified, and wars are regional rather than world-spanning.

title: ⋂ Age of Roads
summary: Empires bind territory with bridges, milestones, and waystations—built for marching columns first, commerce second.

title: ᛏ Age of Conquest
summary: Continental war becomes possible; generations live under levy and siege until exhaustion forces peace.

title: ⋈ Age of Trade
summary: War ends and coin takes over; the old war-roads are inherited by guilds, charters, and contract courts.
